verses.text: Children, listen to the instruction of your father, and act accordingly, that you may be kept safe.
verses.comment: This introduction echoes the wisdom tradition, emphasizing obedience to parental teaching as a sure path to safety, both spiritual and physical.

verses.text: For the Lord has given the father honor over the children and confirmed the authority of the mother over her sons.
verses.comment: This verse reflects the structure God has established within the family, with both father and mother having God-given authority. See the fifth commandment.

verses.text: Whoever honors his father makes atonement for sins,
verses.comment: Honoring one's father is closely tied to forgiveness and reparation, hinting at the idea that practical works of honor are united with spiritual benefit.

verses.text: and whoever glorifies his mother is like one who stores up treasure.
verses.comment: Loving and honoring parents is spiritually valuable, having eternal consequences, as Jesus also teaches about treasures in heaven.

verses.text: Whoever honors his father will be gladdened by his own children, and when he prays, he will be heard.
verses.comment: Compassion and respect towards one's parents lead to a blessed family life and effective prayer. Intergenerational blessing is a biblical theme.

verses.text: Whoever glorifies his father will have length of days, and whoever obeys the Lord will bring comfort to his mother.
verses.comment: Obedience and honor extend life—a repeated biblical promise. Comforting one’s mother through obedience is closely linked with loving God.

verses.text: He who fears the Lord honors his parents and will serve them as masters.
verses.comment: True reverence for God is demonstrated by humble service to one’s parents, showing how love for God and family are inseparable.

verses.text: Honor your father in word and deed, so that a blessing may come upon you from him.
verses.comment: Blessing from father to child is a sacred act, seen through the patriarchs.

verses.text: For a father's blessing strengthens the houses of children, but a mother’s curse uproots their foundations.
verses.comment: Parents have spiritual authority; their words have lasting consequences on their offspring.

verses.text: Do not glorify yourself in your father's disgrace, for your father's shame is no glory to you.
verses.comment: A warning not to take pride in family faults—repentance and humility are always called for.

verses.text: For a man's glory derives from the honor of his father, and it is a disgrace for children to despise their mother.
verses.comment: Family honor and shame affect each member. The relationship with parents shapes a person's legacy.

verses.text: My child, support your father in his old age, and do not grieve him as long as he lives.
verses.comment: Caring for elderly parents is a clear moral duty, displaying love in action.

verses.text: Even if his mind fails, be considerate of him; do not despise him, because you are in your full strength.
verses.comment: Compassion for infirm and aging parents is true virtue, mirroring God’s mercy towards us.

verses.text: For showing kindness to your father will not be forgotten, and it will be credited to you against your sins.
verses.comment: Acts of mercy to family are remembered before God, reminding us of the principle that love covers a multitude of sins.

verses.text: In the day of your distress, it will be remembered in your favor; your sins will melt away as ice in warm weather.
verses.comment: This echoes the teaching that genuine charity and acts of mercy have spiritual effects akin to atonement.

verses.text: Those who abandon their father are like blasphemers, and whoever angers their mother is cursed by the Lord.
verses.comment: Strong language links disrespect for parents directly to sin against God Himself, a consistent biblical principle.

verses.text: My child, perform your works with humility, and you will be loved by those whom God approves.
verses.comment: Humility is consistently praised as a key virtue, both by the wisdom books and in Christ’s own teaching.

verses.text: The greater you are, the more you should humble yourself, and you will find favor with the Lord.
verses.comment: True greatness in God’s eyes is measured by humility—a theme fulfilled perfectly in Christ (see Phil. 2:5-11).

verses.text: Many are lofty and esteemed, but God reveals his secrets to the humble.
verses.comment: God’s ways are hidden from the proud and shown to the lowly, even as Jesus thanks the Father for revealing hidden things to little ones.

verses.text: For great is the power of the Lord; by the humble, he is glorified.
verses.comment: The humble soul becomes a channel for God's glory, as Mary proclaims in the Magnificat.

verses.text: Do not seek what is too difficult for you, nor investigate what is beyond your strength.
verses.comment: A call to intellectual humility—trusting God's revelation and order, rather than seeking mastery over mysteries.

verses.text: Think about what is commanded you, for what is hidden is not your concern.
verses.comment: Obedience and trust in God’s commandments are valued above curiosity about divine mysteries.

verses.text: Do not meddle in matters too difficult for you, for more has been shown you than human understanding can grasp.
verses.comment: God's revelation already exceeds our understanding; seeking beyond it can lead to confusion.

verses.text: For the presumption of evil has led many astray, and foolish thoughts have darkened the mind.
verses.comment: Pride and idle speculation led to spiritual darkness, paralleling Paul’s warnings about the futility of the worldly mind.

verses.text: A stubborn heart will have a hard end, and whoever loves danger will perish in it.
verses.comment: Persistent stubbornness leads to ruin; wisdom consists in humility and repentance.

verses.text: A stubborn heart will be burdened with troubles, and the sinner adds sin upon sin.
verses.comment: Sin begets further sin, and hardness of heart worsens one’s misery.

verses.text: The arrogance of the proud has no healing, for an evil plant takes root in them.
verses.comment: The spiritual disease of pride prevents healing—a central theme in biblical wisdom and in Christ’s teachings.

verses.text: The heart of the prudent thinks about a parable, and attentive ears are the desire of the wise.
verses.comment: Wisdom comes through reflection and attentiveness—Christ used parables to speak to those who truly listened.

verses.text: Water quenches a flaming fire, and almsgiving atones for sins.
verses.comment: True generosity, especially to the poor, is pleasing to God and brings about spiritual benefit—see how this foreshadows the apostolic teaching.

verses.text: Whoever returns good for evil will remember the end, and at the hour of death he will find support.
verses.comment: Good works, especially acts of mercy, prepare the soul for a peaceful death, reminding us that we will be judged by how we love.

verses.text: Those who give to the poor store up treasure for themselves against the day of trouble.
verses.comment: Direct link to Jesus’ discourse on storing up treasure in heaven by charity towards the poor, teaching the virtue of mercy as central to the Christian life.
